org.elasticsearch.painless

Class Locals

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.elasticsearch.painless.Locals

  • public final class Locals
extends java.lang.Object
    Tracks user defined methods and variables across compilation phases.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • newLocalScope

        public static Locals newLocalScope(Locals currentScope)
        Creates a new local variable scope (e.g. loop) inside the current scope

      • newLambdaScope

        public static Locals newLambdaScope(Locals programScope,
                                    Definition.Type returnType,
                                    java.util.List<Locals.Parameter> parameters,
                                    int captureCount,
                                    int maxLoopCounter)
        Creates a new lambda scope inside the current scope

        This is just like newFunctionScope(org.elasticsearch.painless.Locals, org.elasticsearch.painless.Definition.Type, java.util.List<org.elasticsearch.painless.Locals.Parameter>, int), except the captured parameters are made read-only.

      • newFunctionScope

        public static Locals newFunctionScope(Locals programScope,
                                      Definition.Type returnType,
                                      java.util.List<Locals.Parameter> parameters,
                                      int maxLoopCounter)
        Creates a new function scope inside the current scope

      • newMainMethodScope

        public static Locals newMainMethodScope(Locals programScope,
                                        boolean usesScore,
                                        boolean usesCtx,
                                        int maxLoopCounter)
        Creates a new main method scope

      • newProgramScope

        public static Locals newProgramScope(java.util.Collection<Definition.Method> methods)
        Creates a new program scope: the list of methods. It is the parent for all methods

      • hasVariable

        public boolean hasVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if a variable exists or not, in this scope or any parents.

      • getVariable

        public Locals.Variable getVariable(Location location,
                                   java.lang.String name)
        Accesses a variable. This will throw IAE if the variable does not exist

      • getMethod

        public Definition.Method getMethod(Definition.MethodKey key)
        Looks up a method. Returns null if the method does not exist.

      • addVariable

        public Locals.Variable addVariable(Location location,
                                   Definition.Type type,
                                   java.lang.String name,
                                   boolean readonly)
        Creates a new variable. Throws IAE if the variable has already been defined (even in a parent) or reserved.

      • getReturnType

        public Definition.Type getReturnType()
        Return type of this scope (e.g. int, if inside a function that returns int)

      • getProgramScope

        public Locals getProgramScope()
        Returns the top-level program scope.
